chapter.title: RxFtp Method Reference
chapter.para: The following sections describe how the individual methods available in RxFtp are invoked from the Rexx programming environment:

section.title: FtpAnnotateLog
section.para: The FtpAnnotateLog adds a single line to the Trace Log if tracing is on. Otherwise no action is performed.

listitem.para: The line to be added to the log.

section.para: None.

section.title: FtpAppend

indexterm.primary: appending a file to a file on the server

section.para: The FtpAppend method appends a file to another file on the FTP server. If the target file on the server does not exist it is created.

listitem.para: The filename and optional path where the source file is stored.

The filename and optional path of the target file for the append operation on the FTP server. If the path is not given the current directory on the ftp server will be used. If the file does not exist it will be created.
The file transfer mode, either 'ASCII' or 'BINARY'. If the argument is not given the current mode will be used.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpChDir
section.para: The FtpChDir method changes the current directory on the FTP server. If this command fails the directory on the server remains unchanged.

listitem.para: The directory name and optional path to the directory to be made the current directory.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpDelete

indexterm.primary: deleting a file on the server
removing a file on the server

section.para: The FtpDelete method deletes the specified file on the FTP server.

listitem.para: The filename and optional path to the file to be deleted. If the path is not given the file will be deleted from the current directory on the ftp server.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpDir
section.para: The FtpDir method returns a listing (in long format) of a directory on the server. The directory listing is placed in the attribute Response as an Object Rexx array of lines. The array will be empty if this method encounters an error.
The format of the returned directory listing depends on the operating system running on the FTP server machine.

listitem.para: The filename pattern to use to filter the directory listing. You can use the standard '*' and '?' wildcard characters in the pattern. This argument is optional. If this argument is not specified the default pattern './*' will be used.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpGet

indexterm.primary: getting a file from the server
download a file from the server

section.para: The FtpGet method gets a single file from the FTP server.

listitem.para: The filename and optional path where the retrieved file will be stored. If the path is not given the file will be placed in the user's current directory.
The filename and optional path to the file to be retrieved. If the path is not given the file will be retrieved from the current directory on the ftp server.
The file transfer mode, either 'ASCII' or 'BINARY'. If the argument is not given the current mode will be used.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpGetMode

indexterm.primary: mode, getting the file transfer mode

section.para: The FtpGetMode method returns the file transfer mode on the FTP server.
None.
Returns one of the following strings.

listitem.para: The current transfer mode is active.
The current transfer mode is passive.

section.title: FtpGetType

indexterm.primary: type, getting the file transfer mode

section.para: The FtpGetType method returns the file transfer type on the FTP server.
None.
Returns one of the following strings.

listitem.para: The current type is ASCII.
The current type is binary.

section.title: FtpLogoff
section.para: The FtpLogoff method logs off the FTP server and closes the connection. It also reinitializes the instance of the class so it can be used again.
None.
A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpLs
section.para: The FtpLs method returns a listing (in short format) of a directory on the server. The directory listing is placed in the attribute Response as an Object Rexx array of lines. The array will be empty if this method encounters an error.
Each member of the array containing the directory listing usually only contains the name of a file in the specified directory. But the format may be different in some cases.

listitem.para: The filename pattern to use to filter the directory listing. You can use the standard '*' and '?' wildcard characters in the pattern. This argument is optional. If this argument is not specified the default pattern './*' will be used.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpMkDir

indexterm.primary: make a directory on the server
directory on the server, make a

section.para: The FtpMkDir method creates a new subdirectory on the FTP server.

listitem.para: The name and optional path to the new directory.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpPut

indexterm.primary: sending a file to the server
upload a file to the server

section.para: The FtpPut method sends a single file to the FTP server.

listitem.para: The filename and optional path where the source file is stored.
The filename and optional path used to store the file on the FTP server. If the path is not given the file will be stored in the current directory on the ftp server.
The file transfer mode, either 'ASCII' or 'BINARY'. If the argument is not given the current mode will be used.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpPutUnique

indexterm.primary: sending a unique file to the server
upload a unique file to the server

section.para: The FtpPut method sends a single file to the FTP server. If the file exists on the server it is not replaced and a new name is assigned to the file sent from the client.

listitem.para: The filename and optional path where the source file is stored.

The filename and optional path used to store the file on the FTP server. If the filename exists then a new filename is used. If the path is not given the file will be stored in the current directory on the ftp server.
The file transfer mode, either 'ASCII' or 'BINARY'. If the argument is not given the current mode will be used.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpPwd

indexterm.primary: return the current directory on the server
current directory on the server, return the
directory on the server, return the current

section.para: The FtpPwd method returns the current directory name and path on the FTP server. The information is placed in the attribute Response as an Object Rexx array of lines. However, this method always returns a single line to the array if it succeeds. The array will be empty if this method encounters an error.
None.
A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpQuote

indexterm.primary: send a command to the server
command to the server, send a

section.para: The FtpQuote method sends a command to the FTP server.

listitem.para: The command to be executed on the server.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpRename

indexterm.primary: rename a file on the server
move a file on the server

section.para: The FtpRename method renames an existing file on the FTP server. On Unix FTP server this command can also move a file from one subdirectory to another with either a new or its old name.

listitem.para: The name and optional path of the file to be renamed.
The new name and optional path of the file.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpRmDir

indexterm.primary: remove an empty directory on the server

section.para: The FtpRmDir method removes a subdirectory on the FTP server.

listitem.para: The name and optional path to the directory to be removed.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpSetMode

indexterm.primary: mode, setting the file transfer mode

section.para: The FtpSetMode method changes the passive/active mode used for file transfers to/from the FTP server.

listitem.para: Sets passive mode for file transfers. Only the first letter of the argument is significant and it is not case-sensitive.
Sets active mode for file transfers. Only the first letter of the argument is significant and it is not case-sensitive.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.para: If an error is returned the mode remains unchanged.

section.title: FtpSetType

indexterm.primary: type, setting the file transfer mode

section.para: The FtpSetType method changes the file transfer type on the FTP server.

listitem.para: Changes the file transfer type on the FTP server to ASCII. Only the first letter of the argument is significant and it is not case-sensitive.
Changes the file transfer mode on the FTP server to binary. Only the first letter of the argument is significant and it is not case-sensitive.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.para: If an error is returned the type remains unchanged.

section.title: FtpSetUser
section.para: The FtpSetUser method creates a session with an FTP server and logs the user on.

listitem.para: The host name or TCP/IP address of the FTP server.
The user name for the server.
(optional) The user password.
(optional) The accounting information for the user.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.
Unknown host name or server not responding.
RxSock function error.
Server not responding or not available.
user, password or acct information is invalid.

section.title: FtpSite

indexterm.primary: sending a site command to the server
site command to the server, sending a

section.para: The FtpSite method sends a Site command to the FTP server.

listitem.para: The Site command to be executed on the server.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpSys

indexterm.primary: getting the server operating system, getting

section.para: The FtpSys method returns the operating system description information from FTP server. The information is placed in the attribute Response as an Object Rexx array of lines. However, this method always returns a single line to the array if it succeeds. The array will be empty if this method encounters an error.
None.
A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpTrace
section.para: The FtpTrace method starts the tracing of FTP commands. The initial state is off. If tracing is on the FTP commands sent to the server and their responses will be displayed.
None.
A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpTraceLog
section.para: The FtpTraceLog method causes all FTP commands and responses in the current trace buffer to be written to a log file.

listitem.para: The filename and optional path to the log file.
If this argument is given then if the log file exists it will be replaced. The default is to append the trace output to the log file. Only the first letter of the argument is significant.

section.para: A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpTraceLogoff
section.para: The FtpTraceLogoff method stops the tracing of FTP commands.
None.
A value of 0 indicates successful execution of the method. The value -1 indicates an error. You can get the specific error code by inspection of the method FtpErrno. Possible values:

listitem.para: The internal FTP command or the arguments to the method are in error.

section.title: FtpVersion
section.para: The FtpVersion method returns the version number of the RxFtp class in the form of x.x.x.
None.
